g.text: . A negative phase shift of the winter AO/NAO due to the recent Arctic sea-ice reduction in late autumn.
. Arctic moisture source for Eurasian snow cover variations in autumn.
35. Nitta, T., Yoshimura, K. & Abe-Ouchi, A. Impact of Arctic Wetlands on the Climate System: Model Sensitivity Simulations with the
MIROC5 AGCM and a Snow-Fed Wetland Scheme.
. Climate simulations using MRI-AGCM3.2 with 20-km grid.
. The JRA-55 Reanalysis: General specifications and basic characteristics.
Many constructive suggestions from the two reviewers greatly improved the manuscript. The authors
acknowledge support from the Arctic Challenge for Sustainability (ArCS) Project funded by MEXT, Japan. T.S
acknowledges the Grant-in-Aid for Young Scientists A (Grant No. 15H05464) funded by the Japan Society for
the Promotion of Sciences (JSPS). This study used the database for policy decision making for future climate
change (d4PDF) which was produced with the Earth Simulatorunder corporations among science programs
(SOUSEI, TOUGOU, SI-CAT, DIAS) sponsored by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and
Technology (MEXT), Japan. The authors thank James Buxton, MSc, and Kara Bogus, PhD, from Edanz Group
(www.edanzediting.com./ac) for editing a draft of this manuscript.
The authors contributed equally in designing the research and discussing the results. T.S. performed the analysis
and wrote the manuscript. T.N. commented on the manuscript.
The authors declare no competing interests.
